question: <image 1> What does the shaded area represent? P(___< x < ___)
description:
The image shows a graph with a horizontal axis labeled "x" ranging from 0 to 10. A smooth, downward-sloping curve starts at the y-axis near the top left corner and gradually approaches the x-axis as it moves to the right. The curve appears to represent a probability density function (PDF).

On this graph, there is a shaded rectangular area under the curve. This shaded area is located between two vertical lines on the x-axis. The left boundary of the shaded area aligns with the value 6 on the x-axis, and the right boundary aligns with the value 7 on the x-axis. The shaded area represents the probability of the random variable \( x \) falling within the interval from 6 to 7. 

Therefore, the shaded area corresponds to \( P(6 < x < 7) \).
